intro: Gamozygis flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible gamozyg, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white to pale pink blooms that are often fragrant, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to habitat loss, Gamozygis flexuosa is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
